thread.title: Ubuntu Release Focused on Multi-Cloud Environments, Artificial Intelligence

author: Steven Norton
title: Ubuntu Release Focused on Multi-Cloud Environments, Artificial Intelligence
text:
0 COMMENTS Canonical's Mark Shuttleworth in The Wall Street Journal's New York City office Photo: Steven Rosenbush / The Wall Street Journal
Canonical Ltd., creator of the Ubuntu version of the open-source Linux operating system, said its latest release is geared toward multi-cloud environments and provides greater support for enterprise machine learning initiatives.
Calling multi-cloud operations “the new normal,” Canonical founder Mark Shuttleworth said the update, scheduled for release Thursday, has been optimized for performance across major public cloud providers.
Ubuntu 18.04 LTS makes it easier to work with Kubernetes, an open source tool originally created by Google that helps developers manage software containers . Containers allow applications to broken into small pieces and placed int software shells that allow the pieces to be distributed to any sort of device, in a digitally orchestrated manner, and at lower cost.
The new release integrates Kubeflow, a Google project geared toward simplifying machine learning workloads on Kubernetes. Canonical’s distribution of Kubernetes also supports the use of Nvidia Corp.’s graphics processing units, or GPUs, which can speed machine learning calculations.
Other updates include tools that help move legacy workloads into containers, and new security fixes.
